page.title: 08WHEN MY GRAN WAS YOUNG.
page.content: When I went to interview my Gran,Mrs E.Worth she said she prefers in the middle of her life than today because she was more able to do things.She said our school was the same as today, but everyone left at the age of 14, except the farmers' sons who left at the age of 11 and went to Grammar school at Tavistock.The transport you would have had was a bus, but today people without cars suffer because the bus only goes through Lamerton twice a week.They used to play with dolls,skipping ropes and wooden hoops, and they would have played marbles, snap dominoes snakes and ladders,ludo, rounders and hop scotch.Gran said there used to be a wall dividing girls from boys and my mum Mrs.M.Worth said that it was still there when she went to school.Today boys and girls play together.
